results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crocodile hunters
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: In the rivers and billabongs of Northern Territory the aborigine hunts small fresh-water crocodiles using spear and canoe, to provide food for his family. But, in recent years, a new industry has become established in these regions - the hunting of the crocodile for his skin, which brings a high price in the south when manufactured into hand-bags, shoes, wallets and ornaments. Teams of hunters make their camps by the rivers and estuaries where fresh-water and salt-water varieties are found. Photography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: The Cow and the sprite
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. The film is an adaptation of an old Scotch-Irish folk story that tells of the happiness of man and of what it is composed.

results.title: Country school teacher
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of a typical country school teacher in a one teacher school near Lismore, NSW. The teacher is shown teaching his varied class, leading them in games, and taking a useful place in the rural community. The film points out that isolation is one the main difficulties for a rural teacher, showing a conference attended by many such teachers to discuss their problems. Photography by George Lowe. Music by the East Lismore school choir.

results.title: The Country Roads Board gazette No. 10
results.brief_description: Progress report on work of the Country Roads Board; rebuilding the Warrigal Road and the Nepean Highway intersection; new road bridge across the Maribyrnong River at Footscray; construction of a new Air Force air strip; digging storm water drains in the metropolitan areas; maintenance and building of country roads and bridges.

results.title: Cornering and overtaking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates by high angle photography, graphics and animation how certain forces are set in motion when we change direction in a car. Safe methods of cornering, positioning and overtaking are shown, and points of courtesy and common sense in each case are noted.

results.title: The Conquest of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Government of the Commonwealth of Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the arrival of Kingsford-Smith and Ulm at Brisbane on 9th June 1928, after their first successful flight across the Pacific and their official welcome in Sydney including Kingsford Smith’s broadcast greeting to the people.

results.title: Clockwork lemon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Shows the effects of technological change on the worker in the printing industry. Do computers take away the enjoyment of the job? Have a lot of skills been lost? Is job security at risk?
